GoProController

Class GoProController

  • java.lang.Object
    • GoProController.GoProController

  • public class GoProController
extends java.lang.Object

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      GoProController()
      This controls communication with the GoPro camera and the GoPro view.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void connectToGoPro()
      This will launch the process for connecting to a GoPro camera.
      boolean setFov(java.lang.String fov)
      This sets the fov of the camera.
      boolean setResolutionFPS(java.lang.String resolution, java.lang.String fps)
      This sets the resolution and fps of the camera.
      void startRecording()
      This starts the camera recording.
      void stopRecording()
      This stops the camera recording.

    • Constructor Detail

      • GoProController

        public GoProController()
        This controls communication with the GoPro camera and the GoPro view.

    • Method Detail

      • connectToGoPro

        public void connectToGoPro()
        This will launch the process for connecting to a GoPro camera.

      • startRecording

        public void startRecording()
        This starts the camera recording.

      • stopRecording

        public void stopRecording()
        This stops the camera recording.

      • setResolutionFPS

        public boolean setResolutionFPS(java.lang.String resolution,
                                java.lang.String fps)
        This sets the resolution and fps of the camera. The resolution and fps are set simultaneously because they depend on each other.
        Parameters:
        resolution - The desired resolution to set.
        fps - The desired fps to set.
        Returns:
        If the resolution and fps were set correctly, this returns true.

      • setFov

        public boolean setFov(java.lang.String fov)
        This sets the fov of the camera.
        Parameters:
        fov - The desired fov to set.
        Returns:
        If the fov was set correctly, this returns true.
